title: Multiliteracies and Educational Equity in the AI Era: Collaborative Creation and Critical Engagement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and understanding of scientific inquiry methods
context.additional_context: A course exploring the social and ethical impacts of AI tools in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Learners can utilize generative AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, MidJourney) to create two types of theme-related text/image content in a 3-person collaborative project and submit outcomes meeting at least four of the five multi-literacy evaluation criteria: textual coherence, visual logic, and thematic relevance.
Learners can present three or more evaluation criteria for critically analyzing the 'black box' characteristics of AI technology.
Learners can scientifically design AI integration strategies for realizing educational justice by referencing African case studies.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
